poem:
"Red Tape in Blues"

Morning paper news, a dance of politics,
Ukraine's need met with swift bipartisan ticks.
Through months of stalling, moment now arrives,
Aid now unfurling, democracy survives.
Yet, through the motion, divisions reveal,
Loyalties webbing a nation's ordeal.
New day is dawning, yet shadows persist,
The capital's theater again in our midst.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US House approves $61bn in military aid for Ukraine after months of stalling After months of stalling, the US House of Representatives finally approved more than $61bn worth of military assistance to help Ukraine in its desperate defense against Russia. The bipartisan vote saw 210 Democrats and 101 Republicans join to support Ukraine, with 112 Republicans – a majority of the GOP members – voting against. It came after the Republican speaker, Mike Johnson, forced". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
